hook.text: In some cultures, taking a photo of someone can feel like stealing their soul. It's not just a saying.

buildup.text: Indigenous groups in the Amazon, Aboriginal Australians, and some Amish communities refuse photographs.

discovery.text: In many Muslim countries, photographing women without permission can lead to serious legal trouble.

twist.text: Buddhist monks in Southeast Asia often welcome photos. But photographing yourself with a Buddha statue can be illegal.

climax.text: Thailand fined a tourist for posing disrespectfully with a Buddha image. Jail time was also possible.

punchline.text: A photo can be a gift in one culture and a crime in another.

quiz.question: Why do some indigenous cultures refuse to be photographed?
options: They believe photos can capture the soul
